en.title: Divorce application

tooLateToRespond.heading: Contact the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre
tooLateToRespond.info: You can no longer respond to this application online. Contact the service Centre to find out what to do next.

notDefending.heading: You have submitted your response
notDefending.info: Your response will be checked and you'll be contacted about what you need to do next.

defendingAwaitingAnswer.heading: You need to submit your answer
defendingAwaitingAnswer.para1: You must now submit the 'answer to a divorce application' form. The deadline for the court to receive this is 21 days from the date that you first signed in to respond to the application.
defendingAwaitingAnswer.para2: Download and fill in the paper form.
defendingAwaitingAnswer.para4: You'll have to pay a £{{ feesDefendDivorce }} fee when you submit the form.
defendingAwaitingAnswer.para5: You may have to go to a hearing.
defendingAwaitingAnswer.para6: If you don't submit your answer before the deadline, the applicant will be able to continue the divorce as if you hadn't said that you intended to defend it.

defendingSubmittedAnswer.heading: Your answer has been received by the court
defendingSubmittedAnswer.para1: Your ‘answer’ to the divorce application has been received by the court.
defendingSubmittedAnswer.para2: The court will now decide whether you will need to attend a hearing. You may be contacted for more information to help make that decision.
defendingSubmittedAnswer.para3: If you do need to attend a hearing, you’ll be sent a letter in the post telling you when and where the hearing is.

awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.title: The application for a decree nisi has been accepted
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.districtJudge: A district judge will formally announce the decree nisi at a court hearing. This is the first stage of the decree ending the marriage.
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.orderPayDivorceCosts: The court has also decided to make an order that you pay towards the divorce costs.
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.divorceOnlyComplete: The divorce is only complete when the decree absolute has been granted.
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.findMoreDetails: You can find more details about the date of the hearing and the orders that will be made (including costs orders) in the Certificate Of Entitlement ({{ certificateOfEntitlementFile.fileType | upper }}).
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.wantToObject: You don’t need to come to the hearing unless you want to object to the costs order.
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.attendTheHearing: If you want to attend the hearing, you need to email the court before the hearing date.
awaitingPronouncementHearingDate.attendTheHearingCosts: If you want to dispute a costs order, the court must receive a letter or email stating the reasons for doing so at least 14 days before the hearing date.

decreeNisiGranted.heading: The decree nisi has been granted
decreeNisiGranted.dateGranted: On {{ session.originalPetition.decreeNisiGrantedDate | date }} the court granted a:
decreeNisiGranted.decreeNisi: decree nisi - the first stage of the decree ending the marriage
decreeNisiGranted.costsOrder: costs order - giving your applicant the right to claim their divorce costs from you
decreeNisiGranted.whatCostsOrder: What to do with the costs order
decreeNisiGranted.costOrderDetails: The order will state what the court has decided you must pay the applicant. You are required to pay them within 14 days of the order being made. If you don't pay within that time, the applicant can use the order to make a civil money claim against you.
decreeNisiGranted.downloadCostsOrder: Download your costs order ({{ costsOrderFile.fileType | upper }}).

en.helpContent: You can contact the service centre if you need help. Court staff can’t give you legal advice however, and you should speak to a solicitor or legal adviser.
en.improveContent: Please help us improve this service by leaving your feedback.
